### About Me

I am currently a 2nd year graduate student at Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health in the Masters of Science Biostatistics program on the Health Data Science track. My research interest include population health and clinical research in chronic diseases such as Cardiovascular disease, Kidney disease, Diabetes, and Cancer. 

### My Expertise

Coming from a background in Population Health and research, I have theoretical and practical knowledge in study design and data analysis. I have data collection and management experience with coding languages such as R Language, Python, and SAS. 

I excel in statistical analysis, variable modeling, and correlation analysis, driven by a passion for leveraging data to uncover and explain health outcomes. With a strong background in conducting thorough literature reviews for research projects, I am skilled in transforming findings into compelling data visualizations. I have experience in both clinical analysis as well as machine learning prediction based modeling methods.
